content:
Getting a strange error when I try to run the IG publishing tool, seems like all of a sudden.

     [java] Publishing Content Failed: Unknown Content packageId @  START_TAG seen .../jurisdiction>\n      \n    <packageId value="hl7.fhir.cr-core.ig"/>... @29:45 (20.0242sec)

Pulling down the template here: https://github.com/mattkoch614/fhir-ig-build-template and executing sh _genonce.sh runs with no issues...
Does the IG publisher still work for FHIR versions before 4.0.0?
Yes. You may need to wipe your temp and output folders. If that doesn't work, try wiping your cache (on Windows, c:/users/[userid]/.fhir/packages
Sorry for all the questions Lloyd. I tried your suggestion here but I can't get it to build successfully if I set my fhirVersion to 3.0.1. Setting it to 4.0.0 seems to work.
I should note I am on a Mac and tried wiping ~/.fhir/packages
If you're building STU3, your IG needs to be STU3 - which means it shouldn't have a packageId element...

If you're building STU3, your IG needs to be STU3 - which means it shouldn't have a packageId element...

Can the guide be 4.X while the profiles are 3.x, or would this be ill advised?
There might be a way, but I don't remember how off the top of my head...
